headerDisplay: Homebridge plugin for Panasonic Comfort Cloud.

email.title: Email
email.description: The username of your Comfort Cloud (Panasonic ID) account.

password.title: Password
password.description: The password of your Comfort Cloud (Panasonic ID) account.

key2fa.title: 2FA key
key2fa.description: 2FA key received from Panasonic (32 characters). Note: This field is currently not required to make this plugin work, but Panasonic already requires 2FA (code or SMS, recommended code) to log in to Comfort Cloud, so it may be required soon.

name.title: Plugin Name
name.description: Name of the plugin displayed in Homebridge log and as plugin bridge name.

appVersionOverride.title: Comfort Cloud app version (override)
appVersionOverride.description: Leave this field empty to automatically fetch the latest version from the App Store and if that fails, it will use the last known working value which is hard-coded. Filling in this field will make the entered version used (automatic overwriting of versions from the App Store will not work).

suppressOutgoingUpdates.title: Suppress outgoing devices updates
suppressOutgoingUpdates.description: When enabled, changes in the Home app will not be sent to Comfort Cloud. Useful for testing your installation without constantly switching the state of your AC.

logsLevel.title: Logs Level
logsLevel.description: Logs level. 0 - only errors and important info, 1 - standard, 2 - all (including debug). Note: to see debug messages in logs it is also required to enable Debug in Homebridge Settings.

name.title: Name or serial number
name.description: Device name (as it is in Comfort Cloud account) or serial (E.G.: CS-Z50VKEW+2462503161). Devices names and serial numbers are displayed in Homebridge log after restart, names can be also found in Panasonic Comfort Cloud app, serial numbers can be also found on the stickers on the devices.

excludeDevice.title: Exclude device
excludeDevice.description: Exclude device from Homebridge and HomeKit (it will stay in Comfort Cloud).

swingModeDirections.title: Swing Mode Directions
swingModeDirections.description: Desired swing direction(s) activated when swing is switched on.

swingModeDefaultPositionUpDown.title: Swing Mode Default Position (Up-Down)
swingModeDefaultPositionUpDown.description: Desired position of the Up-Down flaps when swing is switched off or the swing directions setting is Left-Right only.

swingModeDefaultPositionLeftRight.title: Swing Mode Default Position (Left-Right)
swingModeDefaultPositionLeftRight.description: Desired position of the Left-Right flaps when swing is switched off or the swing directions setting is Up-Down only.

minHeatingTemperature.title: Minimum heating temperature (override)
minHeatingTemperature.description: The default heating temperature range is 16-30°C. Some Panasonic ACs have an additional heating mode for the range of 8-15°C. You can use this setting to adjust the minimum value. Leave it empty to use the default value.

exposeOutdoorTemp.title: Expose Outdoor Temp
exposeOutdoorTemp.description: When enabled it will create a dummy temperature sensor which will display the temperature from outdoor unit. This can be used for monitoring or automation purposes. Note: It may be required for the device to be turned on to retrieve the current temperature from the outdoor unit.

exposeNanoe.title: Expose Nanoe
exposeNanoe.description: When enabled it will create a switch to control Nanoe.

exposeInsideCleaning.title: Expose Inside Cleaning
exposeInsideCleaning.description: When enabled it will create a switch to control Inside Cleaning.

exposeEcoNavi.title: Expose Eco Navi
exposeEcoNavi.description: When enabled it will create a switch to control Eco Navi.

exposeDryMode.title: Expose Dry Mode
exposeDryMode.description: When enabled it will create a switch to control Dry Mode. Note: disabling this switch will set Auto Mode.

exposeFanMode.title: Expose Fan Mode
exposeFanMode.description: When enabled it will create a switch to control Fan Mode. Note: disabling this switch will set Auto Mode.

exposeQuietMode.title: Expose Quiet Mode
exposeQuietMode.description: When enabled it will create a switch to control Quiet Mode. Quiet Mode can also be enabled by setting the speed slider (rotation) to 1.

exposePowerfulMode.title: Expose Powerful Mode
exposePowerfulMode.description: When enabled it will create a switch to control Powerful Mode. Powerful Mode can also be enabled by setting the speed slider (rotation) to 7.

exposeSwingUpDown.title: Expose Swing Up Down
exposeSwingUpDown.description: When enabled it will create a switch to control Swing Up Down.

exposeSwingLeftRight.title: Expose Swing Left Right
exposeSwingLeftRight.description: When enabled it will create a switch to control Swing Left Right.

layout.title: Devices
layout.description: All devices are automatically added from Comfort Cloud. Here add only those devices for which you want to apply individual settings.
